name: Pickthall
text: Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind, while they turn away in heedlessness.

name: Pickthall
text: Never cometh there unto them a new reminder from their Lord but they listen to it while they play,

name: Pickthall
text: With hearts preoccupied. And they confer in secret. The wrong-doers say: Is this other than a mortal like you? Will ye then succumb to magic when ye see (it)?

name: Pickthall
text: He saith: My Lord knoweth what is spoken in the heaven and the earth. He is the Hearer, the Knower.

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, say they, (these are but) muddled dreams; nay, he hath but invented it; nay, he is but a poet. Let him bring us a portent even as those of old (who were Allah's messengers) were sent (with portents).

name: Pickthall
text: Not a township believed of those which We destroyed before them (though We sent them portents): would they then believe?

name: Pickthall
text: And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men, whom We inspired. Ask the followers of the Reminder if ye know not?

name: Pickthall
text: We gave them not bodies that would not eat food, nor were they immortals.

name: Pickthall
text: Then we fulfilled the promise unto them. So we delivered them and whom We would, and We destroyed the prodigals.

name: Pickthall
text: Now We have revealed unto you a Scripture wherein is your Reminder. Have ye then no sense?

name: Pickthall
text: How many a community that dealt unjustly have We shattered, and raised up after them another folk!

name: Pickthall
text: And, when they felt Our might, behold them fleeing from it!

name: Pickthall
text: (But it was said unto them): Flee not, but return to that (existence) which emasculated you and to your dwellings, that ye may be questioned.

name: Pickthall
text: They cried: Alas for us! we were wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: And this their crying ceased not till We made them as reaped corn, extinct.

name: Pickthall
text: We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in play.

name: Pickthall
text: If We had wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in Our presence - if We ever did.

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but We hurl the true against the false, and it doth break its head and lo! it vanisheth. And yours will be woe for that which ye ascribe (unto Him).

name: Pickthall
text: Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who dwell in His presence are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they weary;

name: Pickthall
text: They glorify (Him) night and day; they flag not.

name: Pickthall
text: Or have they chosen gods from the earth who raise the dead?

name: Pickthall
text: If there were therein gods beside Allah, then verily both (the heavens and the earth) had been disordered. Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the Throne, from all that they ascribe (unto Him).

name: Pickthall
text: He will not be questioned as to that which He doeth, but they will be questioned.

name: Pickthall
text: Or have they chosen other gods beside Him? say: Bring your proof (of their godhead). This is the Reminder of those with me and those before me, but most of them know not the Truth and so they are averse.

name: Pickthall
text: And We sent no messenger before thee but We inspired him, (saying): There is no Allah save Me (Allah), so worship Me.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son. Be He Glorified! Nay, but (those whom they call sons) are honoured slaves;

name: Pickthall
text: They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command.

name: Pickthall
text: He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede except for him whom He accepteth, and they quake for awe of Him.

name: Pickthall
text: And one of them who should say: Lo! I am a god beside Him, that one We should repay with hell. Thus We Repay wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the earth were of one piece, then We parted them, and we made every living thing of water? Will they not then believe?

name: Pickthall
text: And We have placed in the earth firm hills lest it quake with them, and We have placed therein ravines as roads that haply they may find their way.

name: Pickthall
text: And we have made the sky a roof withheld (from them). Yet they turn away from its portents.

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. They float, each in an orbit.

name: Pickthall
text: We appointed immortality for no mortal before thee. What! if thou diest, can they be immortal!

name: Pickthall
text: Every soul must taste of death, and We try you with evil and with good, for ordeal. And unto Us ye will be returned.

name: Pickthall
text: And when those who disbelieve behold thee, they but choose thee out for mockery, (saying): Is this he who maketh mention of your gods? And they would deny all mention of the Beneficent.

name: Pickthall
text: Man is made of haste. I shall show you My portents, but ask Me not to hasten.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: When will this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

name: Pickthall
text: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not be able to drive off the fire from their faces and from their backs, and they will not be helped!

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but it will come upon them unawares so that it will stupefy them, and they will be unable to repel it, neither will they be reprieved.

name: Pickthall
text: Messengers before thee, indeed, were mocked, but that whereat they mocked surrounded those who scoffed at them.

name: Pickthall
text: Say: Who guardeth you in the night or in the day from the Beneficent? Nay, but they turn away from mention of their Lord!

name: Pickthall
text: Or have they gods who can shield them from Us? They cannot help themselves nor can they be defended from Us.

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but We gave these and their fathers ease until life grew long for them. See they not how we aim to the land, reducing it of its outlying parts? Can they then be the victors?

name: Pickthall
text: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I warn you only by the Inspiration. But the deaf hear not the call when they are warned.

name: Pickthall
text: And if a breath of thy Lord's punishment were to touch them, they assuredly would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: And We set a just balance for the Day of Resurrection so that no soul is wronged in aught. Though it be of the weight of a grain of mustard seed, We bring it. And We suffice for reckoners.

name: Pickthall
text: And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) and a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil,

name: Pickthall
text: Those who fear their Lord in secret and who dread the Hour (of doom).

name: Pickthall
text: This is a blessed Reminder that we have revealed: Will ye then reject it?

name: Pickthall
text: And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware of him,

name: Pickthall
text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images unto which ye pay devotion?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them; and I am of those who testify unto that.

name: Pickthall
text: And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone away and turned your backs.

name: Pickthall
text: Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them, that haply they might have recourse to it.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Who hath done this to our gods? Surely it must be some evil-doer.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people's eyes that they may testify.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can speak.

name: Pickthall
text: Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot profit you at all, nor harm you?

name: Pickthall
text: Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then no sense?

name: Pickthall
text: They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing.

name: Pickthall
text: We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham,

name: Pickthall
text: And they wished to set a snare for him, but We made them the greater losers.

name: Pickthall
text: And We rescued him and Lot (and brought them) to the land which We have blessed for (all) peoples.

name: Pickthall
text: And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and Jacob as a grandson. Each of them We made righteous.

name: Pickthall
text: And We made them chiefs who guide by Our command, and We inspired in them the doing of good deeds and the right establishment of worship and the giving of alms, and they were worshippers of Us (alone).

name: Pickthall
text: And unto Lot we gave judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him from the community that did abominations. Lo! they were folk of evil, lewd.

name: Pickthall
text: And We brought him in unto Our mercy. Lo! he was of the righteous.

name: Pickthall
text: And Noah, when he cried of old, We heard his prayer and saved him and his household from the great affliction.

name: Pickthall
text: And delivered him from the people who denied Our revelations. Lo! they were folk of evil, therefor did We drown them all.

name: Pickthall
text: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when people's sheep had strayed and browsed therein by night; and We were witnesses to their judgment.

name: Pickthall
text: And We made Solomon to understand (the case); and unto each of them We gave judgment and knowledge. And we subdued the hills and the birds to hymn (His) praise along with David. We were the doers (thereof).

name: Pickthall
text: And We taught him the art of making garments (of mail) to protect you in your daring. Are ye then thankful?

name: Pickthall
text: And unto Solomon (We subdued) the wind in its raging. It set by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And of everything We are Aware.

name: Pickthall
text: And of the evil ones (subdued We unto him) some who dived (for pearls) for him and did other work, and We were warders unto them.

name: Pickthall
text: And Job, when he cried unto his Lord, (saying): Lo! adversity afflicteth me, and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We heard his prayer and removed that adversity from which he suffered, and We gave him his household (that he had lost) and the like thereof along with them, a mercy from Our store, and a remembrance for the worshippers;

name: Pickthall
text: And (mention) Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhu'l-Kifl. All were of the steadfast.

name: Pickthall
text: And We brought them in unto Our mercy. Lo! they are among the righteous.

name: Pickthall
text: And (mention) Dhu'n-Nun, when he went off in anger and deemed that We had no power over him, but he cried out in the darkness, saying: There is no Allah save Thee. Be Thou Glorified! Lo! I have been a wrong-doer.

name: Pickthall
text: Then we heard his prayer and saved him from the anguish. Thus we save believers.

name: Pickthall
text: And Zachariah, when he cried unto his Lord: My Lord! Leave me not childless, though Thou art the Best of inheritors.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We heard his prayer, and bestowed upon him John, and adjusted his wife (to bear a child) for him. Lo! they used to vie one with the other in good deeds, and they cried unto Us in longing and in fear, and were submissive unto Us.

name: Pickthall
text: And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something) of Our Spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

name: Pickthall
text: And they have broken their religion (into fragments) among them, (yet) all are returning unto Us.

name: Pickthall
text: Then whoso doeth some good works and is a believer, there will be no rejection of his effort. Lo! We record (it) for him.

name: Pickthall
text: And there is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed: that they shall not return.

name: Pickthall
text: Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they hasten out of every mound,

name: Pickthall
text: And the True Promise draweth nigh; then behold them, staring wide (in terror), the eyes of those who disbelieve! (They say): Alas for us! We (lived) in forgetfulness of this. Ah, but we were wrong-doers!

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! ye (idolaters) and that which ye worship beside Allah are fuel of hell. Thereunto ye will come.

name: Pickthall
text: If these had been gods they would not have come thither, but all will abide therein.

name: Pickthall
text: Therein wailing is their portion, and therein they hear not.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! those unto whom kindness hath gone forth before from Us, they will be far removed from thence.

name: Pickthall
text: They will not hear the slightest sound thereof, while they abide in that which their souls desire.

name: Pickthall
text: The Supreme Horror will not grieve them, and the angels will welcome them, (saying): This is your Day which ye were promised;

name: Pickthall
text: The Day when We shall roll up the heavens as a recorder rolleth up a written scroll. As We began the first creation, We shall repeat it. (It is) a promise (binding) upon Us. Lo! We are to perform it.

name: Pickthall
text: And verily we have written in the Scripture, after the Reminder: My righteous slaves will inherit the earth:

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! there is a plain statement for folk who are devout.

name: Pickthall
text: We sent thee not save as a mercy for the peoples.

name: Pickthall
text: Say: It is only inspired in me that your Allah is One Allah. Will ye then surrender (unto Him)?

name: Pickthall
text: But if they are averse, then say: I have warned you all alike, although I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! He knoweth that which is said openly, and that which ye conceal.

name: Pickthall
text: And I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and enjoyment for a while.

name: Pickthall
text: He saith: My Lord! Judge Thou with truth. Our Lord is the Beneficent, Whose help is to be implored against that which ye ascribe (unto Him).
